}
```

When we are trying to change email of `user2` through the `rails_admin`, changed `admin` email instead of `user2`. When I dive to `rails_admin` [edit action code](https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/blob/d521b54bbb78389ea8ed311b5d8e02da00746202/lib/rails_admin/config/actions/edit.rb), I discovered for this lines:
```ruby
@authorization_adapter && @authorization_adapter.attributes_for(:update, @abstract_model).each do |name, value|
  @object.send("#{name}=", value)
end
```
evaluate to this:
```ruby
# @object.id is "52c1f3646d6b005564000002"
@object.send("id=", "52c1f3646d6b005564000001") # set the current logged user.id
```
because I have cancan rule `can :update, User, id => user.id`

as a workaround I just change rule to this:
```ruby
can :update, User do |object|
   object.id == user.id
end
```
and all work as expected.

I think that you should know about this behavior.

    class User < ActiveRecord::Base

Rails admin throws a `NoMethodError` error when loading the edit page NoMethodError in RailsAdmin::Main#edit

rimary_key)] }.sort_by {|a| [selected_ids.index(a[1]) || selected_ids.size, i+=1] }

suspect I must be doing something dumb but I've had a weird issue going on ever since I added RailsAdmin to my Rails app.

Basically I can see raw HTML output at the bottom of all new and edit RailsAdmin forms:

![raw railsadmin html](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/562403/1727677/8cc777cc-62a2-11e3-9f7e-fd4733bffdee.png)

The action buttons on that page don't work because they are not contained within the `<form>` tag that you would expect them to be. If I inspect the DOM, you can see a `<fieldset>` within which the buttons exist and a sibling `<form>` which wraps the raw HTML output, further down the DOM tree.

![buttons not in form element](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/562403/1727707/1ee4e1ee-62a3-11e3-8476-5da1ac78fd6b.png)

My first thought was that this is a Pjax issue but there's no JS console errors or important warnings.

My second thought was that some other Gem in my app was clashing with RailsAdmin. I've tried running the app without (for example) turbolinks and [foundation-rails][1] but it doesn't seem to make a difference.

I'm running Rails 4.0.2 on Ruby 2.0.0p247. The issue exists both in development (OX X Mavericks) and in production (Ubuntu 13.10).

Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help diagnose.

[1]: https://github.com/zurb/foundation-rails

TorqueBox 3.0.0
rails_admin 0.6.0 via master

Traced this to early in Rails bootstrapping to:
jruby_179/lib/ruby/gems/shared/bundler/gems/safe_yaml/lib/safe_yaml/load.rb: 35

Traced the safe_yaml dependecy to rails_admin.

Found this recent issue + commit over at safe_yaml...
"When Syck is not present at all, stub it out and proceed"

https://github.com/dtao/safe_yaml/commit/f227195b9e3731463f8dd6b2ab6247ce3e0e97c3

gem 'safe_yaml', git: 'https://github.com/dtao/safe_yaml.git'

I've reviewed https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/wiki/How-to-set-default-values and https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/wiki/How-to-set-current_user-to-the-field, but I would like to do it during the `#create` action in the controller to prevent tampering. I saw a similar request at https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/issues/756, but that was closed with the note "Closing because custom actions are already implemented." My question is related to this particular line: https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/blob/master/lib/rails_admin/config/actions/edit.rb#L29

My situation involves 2 models plus one for the join table.
The model for the join table includes a validation check.

What I want is validates the relation between `Licence` and `LicenceType`.

```ruby
class Licence < ActiveRecord::Base

  has_many :licence_type_licences
  has_many :licence_types, through: :licence_type_licences

  #...
end
```

The _join table_ model:

```ruby
class LicenceTypeLicence < ActiveRecord::Base
  belongs_to :licence
  belongs_to :licence_type

  validate :check_pair_source_role

private
  def check_pair_source_role
    # ...
  end
end
```

Here the stack trace when I try to make an edit that should results in a validation failure:

```

  (eval):8:in `edit'
```

Updating my model Licence raise (correctly) an exception, but rails_admin doesn't handle it... `set_attributes` try to save my _join table model_.
How can I have a more graceful behaviour?

  def perform_search_on_associated_collection(field_name, conditions)
    target_association = associations.find{|a| a[:name] == field_name }
    return [] unless target_association
    model = target_association[:model_proc].call
    case target_association[:type]
    when :belongs_to, :has_and_belongs_to_many
      [{ target_association[:foreign_key].to_s => { '$in' => model.where('$or' => conditions).all.map{|r| r.send(target_association[:primary_key_proc].call)} }}]
    when :has_many
      [{ target_association[:primary_key_proc].call.to_s => { '$in' => model.where('$or' => conditions).all.map{|r| r.send(target_association[:foreign_key])} }}]
    end
  end

"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1845","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1845/labels{/name}","comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1845/comments","events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1845/events","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1845","id":23182601,"number":1845,"title":"Polymorphic relation IDs are converted to strings with mongoid","user":{"login":"glebtv","id":1041407,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/1b2c9760a56e43ca2723cf5b25fdfedb?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fc3d31d44af741da8794077544abd3118.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"1b2c9760a56e43ca2723cf5b25fdfedb","url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv","html_url":"https://github.com/glebtv","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/glebtv/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"labels":[],"state":"open","assignee":null,"milestone":null,"comments":0,"created_at":"2013-11-23T06:12:52Z","updated_at":"2013-11-23T06:13:34Z","closed_at":null,"body":"Mongoid won't fix it on their side: mongoid/mongoid#3386 saying it is 'by design', so I am reopening this here:

Currently, in mongoid polymorphic relation when setting id as string it is stored as string.
This doesn't break loading of relation (comment.commentable), but it breaks inverse relation (commenable.comments)

Rails Admin is setting polymorphic relations exactly this way, as strings, which breaks a lot of things in my apps after saving a model in rails_admin.

Currently, i am using a workaround like this:
```
before_validation do
  if commentable_id.class.name == 'String'
    self.commentable_id = BSON::ObjectId.from_string(commentable_id)
  end
  true
end
```

This is a pretty bad problem, because it causes comments to not be shown in app after any operation on them in rails admin.

Is there any easy way to properly fix this in rails admin without having to use workarounds like this?"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1844","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1844/labels{/name}","comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1844/comments","events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1844/events","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/issues/1844","id":23179574,"number":1844,"title":"No @object visibility in register_instance_option :member?","user":{"login":"mbhnyc","id":226280,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/2f1c4d147215ece22720120ee69db764?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fd553e7253cbe3c98d44a3ec40142fa71.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"2f1c4d147215ece22720120ee69db764","url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc","html_url":"https://github.com/mbhnyc","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mbhnyc/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"labels":[],"state":"open","assignee":null,"milestone":null,"comments":0,"created_at":"2013-11-23T02:10:29Z","updated_at":"2013-11-23T02:13:13Z","closed_at":null,"body":"Guys-

Assumed this would be easy, but the 30 permutations i've tried haven't worked, so thought an issue would work:

So I have a custom action on member pages, which is working great — but the action CAN throw an exception, so I'm trying to either 1) hide it when it doesn't apply to the specific object, or at least 2) rescue from the exception.

Relevant sections of the action:

```
module RailsAdmin
  module Config
    module Actions
      class EnterpriseSubscriptionSwitch < RailsAdmin::Config::Actions::Base
        register_instance_option :member? do
          true
        end

        register_instance_option :controller do
          Proc.new do
            Subscription.switch(u, BillingPlan.where(short_name: 'ent-1').first)
            flash[:notice] = "User switched to Enterprise Billing Plan"
            redirect_to back_or_index
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end
```

But when I add an @ object test into the ```:member?``` call, it comes back as ```nil```.
